page.title: 16BOREHAM A RESIDENTS MEMORIES
page.content: A resident ,born in 1917 who has lived in Boreham all her life has seen many changes.There have been many improvements that have made life easier. She remembers as a child gathering sticks for firewood, especially after a storm, collecting water from a stream, and milk from a nearby farm.She now has an electric fire, milk delivered and water on tap. Children living in cottages and farms had a long walk to school, and in winter they would leave home and return in the dark. Our resident remembers with regret some of the fine houses that were demolished to make way for the A.12. trunk road.To the north of the A.12 there was a rifle range used between the 2 World Wars, by the Territorial Army.On market days she watched cows and sheep being driven to market.
